name: Avoid Artifacts with SQL statement including subqueries
description: Artifacts should not use SQL statement including subqueries (at least subqueries should be avoided).
output:
This report lists all Artifacts with SQL statement including subqueries.
It provides the following information:
- Artifact full name
- Number of Subqueries
rationale: Having complex queries in Artifacts can cause performance problems. Queries with subqueries are considered complex.
remediation: Review the design of the query to avoid possible Subqueries

technicalCriteria.name: Efficiency - SQL and Data Handling Performance

qualityStandards.name: Complex read/write access
qualityStandards.description: Remove instances where a very large table, that is, whose number of rows exceeds a threshold value (default is 1,000,000 rows), is accessed by a SQL statement with too many joins (default threshold value for the maximum number of joins is 5), and too many sub-queries (default threshold value for the maximum number of sub-queries is 3).

qualityStandards.name: Cross-Site Scripting (XSS)
qualityStandards.description: XSS flaws occur whenever an application takes untrusted data and sends it to a web browser without proper validation or escaping. XSS allows attackers to execute scripts in the victims' browser which can hijack user sessions, deface web sites, or redirect the user to malicious sites.
